greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals upwards in which T(n,k) is the product of the n-th noncomposite number and the sum of the divisors of k, n>=1, k>=1.
example: The corner of the square array begins:
mathematica: Table[If[# == 1, 1, Prime[# - 1]] DivisorSigma[1, k] &@(n - k + 1), {n, 12}, {k, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 28 2016 *)
xref: The diagonal 2, 9, 20... is A272211, the main diagonal of A272214.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 28 2016
